entries.meaning: (emergency medicine) A method of moving a patient, rolling them onto their side, and later onto a transport method such as a tarp, spineboard, or stretcher.

verbs.description: logroll (third-person singular simple present logrolls, present participle logrolling, simple past and past participle logrolled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To combine legislative items, either or both of which might fail on its own, into a single bill that is more likely to pass.
examples: Republicans defeated Democratic efforts to logroll hate crimes legislation into the defense appropriations bill.

entries.meaning: To roll a log in a body of water, while balancing on it; to birl.
(transitive) To safely move (a body) in an emergency (medical) situation, tilting them up, then laying them on a transport surface.
